definition: dragged down by having a family to feed
to drag/to tow/to trail/to hang down/to mop (the floor)/to delay/to drag on
variant of 拖[tuo1]

home/family/(polite) my (sister, uncle etc)/classifier for families or businesses/refers to the philosophical schools of pre-Han China/noun suffix for a specialist in some activity, such as a musician or revolutionary, corresponding to English -ist, -er, -ary or -ian/CL:個|个[ge4]
see 傢伙|家伙[jia1 huo5]
band/belt/girdle/ribbon/tire/area/zone/region/CL:條|条[tiao2]/to wear/to carry/to take along/to bear (i.e. to have)/to lead/to bring/to look after/to raise
mouth/classifier for things with mouths (people, domestic animals, cannons, wells etc)/classifier for bites or mouthfuls

sentences.english: This time, he had a wife and family in tow, but it made little difference.
sentences.chinese: 这一次搬家，他拖家带口，但是终究也没什么区别。

sentences.english: To realize the value of ONE DAY, ask a daily wage laborer with kids to feed.
sentences.chinese: 想知道“一天”的价值，问一个拖家带口的劳工。

definition: to bear the burden of a household (idiom); encumbered by a family/tied down by family obligations
supporting a wife and children/dragged down by having a family to feed
to take all one's family along (idiom); encumbered by a family/tied down by family obligations
to take all one's family along (idiom); encumbered by a family/tied down by family obligations
to run away from trouble/to flee from calamity/to be a refugee
to leave one's native place, esp. against one's will (idiom)
taking everyone along, young and old/to look after the elderly and the young
the whole family
the old and the young/the youngest member of the family
to escape from a famine/to get away from a famine-stricken region
the whole family
to eke out a living/to live from hand to mouth/to drift aimlessly
making up a group, forming a troupe (idiom); in large numbers/as a large crowd
to leave one's homeplace (to find work, flee disaster etc)
to troop (of soldiers etc)/convoy
another part of the country/some other place
